intro: Hosackia sulphurea, commonly known as the yellow false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
